bookmark.title: Ars Technica
bookmark.desc: A good blog site, with a lot of techie articles.

bookmark.title: Extreme Tech
bookmark.desc: Another good one. Extreme tech is nice because they are not afraid to go in depth, but the articles are still pretty generally accessible.

bookmark.title: Mechanical Keyboard
bookmark.desc: Clicky keys, like the Madmen days. Tactile feedback, and compact layout. Cherry MX red are pretty standard mech switches. The others are too loud/forceful or a little weak.

bookmark.title: Leatherman Bomb Defuser
bookmark.desc: The Leatherman Bomb Defuser is a snarkily named pocket sized multi-tool useful for electronics and hobby tinkering / hacking.

bookmark.title: 500GB Samsung SSD
bookmark.desc: An SSD can make a computer much quicker by reducing the performance bottlenecks caused by data I/O. This is especially apparent with reboots, backups, app loads/splashscreens, and downloads. The HDD is normally the only non-trivial moving part in a laptop so replacing it with a silent and solid drive makes the whole laptop more stable.

bookmark.title: Audio-Technica ATH Pro 700 Headphones
bookmark.desc: Audio-Technica are generally a leader in headphones, and these have boosted lows. Perfect for Dubstep, Trap and Bass, and other electronic music.

bookmark.title: Adopt a Penguin
bookmark.desc: Because stealing a penguin is a felony.

bookmark.title: Project Page
bookmark.desc: A headphone amplifier using a 12AU7 vacuum tube. Uses low voltage, which makes it safe as a hobby project. The description is beginner friendly, kind of in the happy medium between "circuit stuffing" and purely theoretical.

bookmark.title: You-do-It Electronics
bookmark.desc: An Electronics store in Needham which carries most of the parts needed.

bookmark.title: Radio Shack - Mosfets
bookmark.desc: You-do-It does not carry these particular Mosfets.

bookmark.title: Forums
bookmark.desc: This is a forum for discussing people's implementations of this project. Common pitfalls and creative twists abound.

bookmark.title: Recipe
bookmark.desc: A recipe for homemade tonic water.

bookmark.title: Citric Acid - Amazon
bookmark.desc: Lowers the PH, adds flavor. Crucial to the recipe.

bookmark.title: French Press - Amazon
bookmark.desc: Faster than letting it drip through a filter.
